content.description:
Scientists were interested in testing the effects of rotenone, a broad-spectrum pesticide, on a cell culture. Cell culture <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was used as a control, while culture <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was treated with rotenone. After a period of time, the scientists measured the concentration of several metabolites in the mitochondria of cells in both cultures. Their results are shown in the table below.

Metabolites
 Concentration in Culture <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mtext>A</mtext></mstyle><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="micromolar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>μ</mtext><mtext>M</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Concentration in Culture <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="micromolar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>μ</mtext><mtext>M</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Pyruvate
 <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
  <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A D P plus P i" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ADP+</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>i</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

content.question: Based on the data in the table, which of the following best explains the effects of rotenone on cellular respiration?

choices.label: Rotenone acts as an inhibitor of the enzymes in the Krebs cycle.

<math alttext="N A D H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, produced during glycolysis, is not able to enter the mitochondria because transport proteins are blocked from entering.

Treated cells are not able to break down <math alttext="N A D H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because certain enzymes of the electron transport chain are inhibited.
Rotenone acts as an allosteric inhibitor of glycolytic enzymes, thus inhibiting cellular respiration.

content.answer: Treated cells are not able to break down <math alttext="N A D H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because certain enzymes of the electron transport chain are inhibited.

skill.text: 6.D: Explain the relationship between experimental results and larger biological concepts, processes, or theories.
